definition: as if/to seem like
to be fond of/to have a tendency to/to be prone to
good/well/proper/good to/easy to/very/so/(suffix indicating completion or readiness)/(of two people) close/on intimate terms/(after a personal pronoun) hello
to resemble/to be like/to look as if/such as/appearance/image/portrait/image under a mapping (math.)

sentences.english: It looks like I'm missing one of my carry-ons from the plane.
sentences.chinese: 我好像在飞机上丢失了一件随身携带的行李。

sentences.english: Breathe out through pursed lips as if you were whistling.
sentences.chinese: 从闭合嘴唇中呼气，就好像在吹口哨。

sentences.english: Just as if some one was kissing the window all over outside.
sentences.chinese: 就好像有人从外面把窗子吻了个遍。

sentences.english: The taste of ice-cream would be like a blender mixing whip-cream evenly.
sentences.chinese: 吃冰淇淋的滋味就好像打果机把冰淇淋打得很均匀。

sentences.english: Seems like only last week she was still just a bairn .
sentences.chinese: 好像几个星期前她还只是个小孩呢。

sentences.english: In my vagabond years most derelicts seemed to be white.
sentences.chinese: 在我流浪那些年，大多数被遗弃的男人好像都是白人。

sentences.english: He acts as if he owned the place.
sentences.chinese: 他的举止行为就好像他是那个地方的主人。

sentences.english: Well, doesn't want us to set mo to true here.
sentences.chinese: 好了，这里好像不想让我们把它设为真。

sentences.english: He made everything so simple, it was like magic.
sentences.chinese: 他的曲子很简单，就好像魔术。

sentences.english: The Four Wonders of the Huangshan Mountain are absolutely breathtaking. I felt as if I had been in a different world.
sentences.chinese: 黄山的四绝真神奇，我感觉好像置身于一个世外桃源。

sentences.english: 'To me, it's just like when you are looking for a new job,' says the owner of a Los Angeles skin-care company.
sentences.chinese: 她说，对我而言，这就好像是在找一份新的工作。

sentences.english: B: Well, that sounds like it would be OK. Just be careful.
sentences.chinese: 是么，那听起来好像还可以答应，只是要小心一点。

sentences.english: And the sound of the cherubims' wings was heard even to the outer court, as the voice of the Almighty God when he speaketh.
sentences.chinese: 基路伯翅膀的响声听到外院，好像全能神说话的声音。

sentences.english: But wait a minute, I've already written buggy code it seems.
sentences.chinese: 先等等，好像我已经写了有bug的代码。

sentences.english: It looks like the President received illegal campaign donations.
sentences.chinese: 总统好像收受了非法的选举贿金。

sentences.english: OK, so the question is about Bluetooth. I think I heard.
sentences.chinese: 好，问题时关于蓝牙吧，我好像听清了。

definition: apparently/to seem/to appear/as if/seemingly
variant of 彷彿|仿佛[fang3 fu2]
to seem/as if/alike/similar
seems as if/rather like/Taiwan pr. [si4 de5]
to appear to be/to seem as if
to feel/to become aware of/feeling/sense/perception/CL:個|个[ge4]
but/however/(used for emphasis) indeed
to resemble/to be like/to look as if/such as/appearance/image/portrait/image under a mapping (math.)
is or isn't/yes or no/whether or not
to think/to feel
interjection or grunt of agreement/uhm/Ah, OK/expression of recognition/Oh, it's you!
modal particle ending sentence, showing affirmation, approval, or consent
interjection of surprise/Ah!/Oh!
interjection expressing doubt or requiring answer/Eh?/what?
interjection of surprise or doubt/Eh?/My!/what's up?
actually/in fact/really
same/like/equal to/the same as/just like
I/me/my
(particle equivalent to 啊 after a vowel, expressing surprise or doubt)
a little
obviously/plainly/undoubtedly/definitely
